characters: A POLICE OFFICER THROWS TEAR GAS INTO THE CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the kind of place that feels like everyone shoul know your name. But they don’t. Families frequent this sp when they’ve fallen on hard times. It’s practically empty this boring Thursday. SERVERS drop off hot plates while ELDERLY PEOPLE sip cheap coffee at the counter. Our focus is directed toward a BLACK MAN and a BLACK WOMA sitting in a small booth in the back. The MAN: has a slender frame and a laid back demeanor. He not a fan of rocking the boat or ruffling feathers, but h ain’t no punk either. For the purpose of this story we’ll call him SLIM. The WOMAN: She’s regal as fuck. She’s not an easy laugh a she’s always waiting for the other shoe to drop. For the purposes of this story, we’ll call her QUEEN. Not unlike most first dates there are long silences and a of forced small talk. The WAITRESS quickly drops off their food and walks away without uttering a word. Queen examines the spread. Slim prays over his food. This is how he was raised. Quee sits awkwardly waiting for him to look up. As soon as he does --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Didn't you ask for scrambled eggs?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. She clocks the two sunny side up eggs on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all good.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s just eggs.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I have a thing about that.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Eggs?  They have

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, about people not doing their job well.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: She's got four kids and an alcoholic husband at home. She’s doing the best she can.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: She comes through my line every Sunday, yelling at her kids and giving me a stack of coupons. She can never find her Costco card so I always let her use mine so she can get the discount.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, can you?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Easy, I know good grammar.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We not in a classroom. a quick standoff.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You gonna ask me your question or not?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What took you so long to respond to me?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t realize that much time had passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent you a very well crafted message three weeks ago. I spell checked it and everything and got crickets. Then today, out of the blue, you hit me up asking if I wanna grab dinner. What changed?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I had a shitty day.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What was so shitty about it?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: The state decided to execute my client. Queen says that as if she were giving him the logline to least favorite movie. In an instant Slim loses his appetite.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I didn’t know that was still legal here.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yup. It’s legal in 31 states. And Ohio happens to be one of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Was he innocent?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Even if he’s not - the state shouldn’t decide whether he lives or dies.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Me too. (then) Normally, I’d just go home and have a glass of wine by myself. But I didn’t feel like being alone. Not tonight. Slim can't tell if this is a cry for help or a propositio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn’t have any friends or family you could call? Slim sips his soda. Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: So you turned to Tinder?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why'd you pick me?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I liked your picture.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: (flattered) Word?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You had this sad look on your face. I felt sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean for that to sound shady.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Well it did.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My dad took that picture of me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Why aren't you smiling? Slim shrugs. Not ready to divulge the reason just yet. They're still getting to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: To be honest, I don’t have that many photos of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I know what I look like.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Pictures aren’t just about vanity. They're proof of your existence.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: My family knows I exist. That’s enough. The idea of not having to prove oneself to the world is foreign to Queen. Slim stares at Queen’s plate. Most of her food is untouch Particularly her Caesar salad.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gon eat that?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You can have some. He reaches over and stabs a few big pieces of lettuce wit his fork.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: They always use just the right amount of dressing. Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you really like this place or is it the only spot you could afford?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s black owned. She wasn’t expecting that answer. Queen can appreciate th small token of righteousness.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Touché.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim drives a WHITE HONDA ACCORD. Yeah, he don’t give a f about cars. He tries to create a vibe by playing some neo soul music. Which is regular soul music with a hint of patchouli. He keeps looking down at his phone. Checking the directio

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t text and drive.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ain’t nobody texting. I’m making sure I don’t get lost. She grabs Slim’s phone from his lap.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I can tell you how to get to my hotel.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Give me my phone!

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Relax. I’m gonna give it back.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You gon tell me where to turn?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Queen points left.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh so now you gon point the directions?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m telling you where to go. Slim is visibly annoyed. Queen starts sifting through his phone.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You made a playlist? That’s cute. Slim tries to grab his phone back, unsuccessfully.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Don’t go through my phone!  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Did you like “In a Sentimental Mood” before or after “Love Jones”?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I knew about that shit way before “Love Jones.”

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t lie.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Okay - I fucked with it more after I saw the movie.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I appreciate your honesty. Then --

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: So what happens tonight?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You’re gonna drop me off and you’1ll go home, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Did you think we were gonna have sex? Slim is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No. I thought we were gonna hang out. Maybe get to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m good. Slim takes his phone back from Queen causing him to SWERV bit. Then he SWITCHES LANES without signaling. Just as he starts to pick up speed. He hears a horrifying sound. WOOP WOOP. Every black person’s worst nightmare.  8. We hear a robotic voice muffled through a loud speaker: “ over. That corner right there.” Slim’s heart starts to race. Queen’s heart beats at its u speed.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have any warrants?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, I ain’t got no warrants.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you have any weapons in the car? Any narcotics?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I got a pocket knife in the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I know it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE OFFICER steps out of his car and makes his way Slim’s door. He motions for Slim to roll down his window. He does.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Can you turn the radio down? Slim pauses for a beat. Then he does as he’s told. He’s always been good at being obedient. The Police Officer aims the light directly in Slim’s eyes Slim quickly shields his face so he can see what’s in fro of him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your hand down. He does as he’s told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only had it up because you were shining a light in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I’m trying to see inside the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s just us.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: License and registration. Slim reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m grabbing my wallet.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Well, y’all like to shoot first and ask questions later.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do you have something you wanna say to me?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. Slim hands over his license. Slowly. As he reaches over t rummage through his glove compartment his hand accidental grazes Queen’s thigh. He’s not being fresh. Just nervous. finally finds his crumpled up registration and hands it o

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do you know why I pulled you over?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You forgot to use your signal back there. And you swerved a bit. Queen shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh, my bad.  10.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. The Police Officer takes Slim’s license and registration slowly walks back to his squad car. Queen sits there. Seething. Slim is calm as a cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I can’t believe this shit.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Just chill. She doesn’t like being told what to do.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I told you to chill out.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I have a right to be angry.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I ain’t tryna die tonight. The weight of that statement leaps out of Slim’s soul and lands in Queen’s lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Officer talks to his DISPATCHER. On his dashboard we see a PHOTO. It’s a picture of his WI and KIDS. The Kids are TWIN BOYS. They both have blonde hair and gr eyes. They’re completely unaware of how privileged their lives will be simply because they were born white and mal The Wife is a bored brunette whose dreams are no bigger t her backyard.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: Whattya got?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Black male. Black female. Both late twenties. They’re in a white Honda. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Driver changed lanes without signaling. He was driving erratically.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: Is he under the influence?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I don’t know yet. I’11 make him do a breathalyzer.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: Let me know if you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer is back at Slim’s window - leaning in a littl too close.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Will you step out of the vehicle, please?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Can I ask why, Officer?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: No, you can’t. Step out of the car. Before he gets out of the car Queen and Slim lock eyes. H doesn’t know Queen very well, but he can tell she has the spirit of Nat Turner wrestling inside of her. Slim steps out and puts his hands on the roof of the car. Police Officer proceeds to search him, aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got any sharp objects in your pockets I should know about?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Any illegal substances?  12.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: What about in the vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen’s left knee bounces uncontrollably. Her chest goes and down. Queen looks in the rearview mirror and sees the Police Officer interrogating Slim on the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Officer finishes patting Slim down.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Have you been drinking tonight?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No. Slim laughs.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Why is that funny?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Cause I don’t drink.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, pop the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Because I asked you to. Slim hesitates.  13.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ain’t nothing in there but some shoe boxes.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Let’s see ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Okay. Queen HONKS the horn in an effort to get the Police Offic attention.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you have a warrant?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am, he’s already agreed to the search. So I don’t need one. Slim pops the trunk. He was telling the truth. The only thing in his trunk are bunch of sneakers. Consumerism is his only vice. Slim feels vindicated and violated at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Told you.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can we go now? The Officer’s cheeks turn bright red.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: What’s in the boxes?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Shoes.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna check just to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Fine. Then.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you please hurry up?  14. And just like that a SWITCH GOES OFF in the Police Office head. He feels disrespected. His uniform isn’t as intimidating as he thought it was. His super powers are imaginary. So he goes from 2018 to 1953 real quick. He PULLS OUT HIS GUN and AIMS IT AT SLIM.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Get on the ground and put your hands behind your back, now!

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Get on the ground! Slim does as he’s told. The Officer keeps the gun pointed at Slim’s head while looking at Slim’s car to make sure Queen stays inside. But after a beat she GETS OUT OF THE CAR to see what the is going on.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Why is he under arrest? The Officer turns around and AIMS HIS GUN AT HER. With on hand. The other hand stays planted on Slim’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ma’am if you don’t get back in the car I’m gonna have to arrest you too.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I'm happy to get back in the car, but would you mind telling me why you're arresting him?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Get back in the vehicle now!

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m reaching for my cell phone --

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Keep your hands where I can see them! !

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I have the right to record this arrest.  15. Queen REACHES in her pocket. Officer Reed AIMS HIS GUN AT HER and FIRES OFF TWO SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The first shot misses her, but the SECOND SHOT GRAZES HER RIGHT THIGH. She collapses to the ground. And hits her he on the pavement. Slim SCREAMS for her. He tries to run toward her, but Off Reed grabs him by the shoulders and slams him on the grou Officer Reed and Slim roll around on the ground for a few seconds. Until Officer Reed finally pins Slim to the grou and points the gun at his face.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER REED
dialogues.text: Don’t move! Officer Reed sees Queen trying to get up. He points his g at her again - while the Officer’s attention is diverted Slim KNOCKS the firearm out of his hand. When the gun goes flying - Officer Reed reaches for it, b Slim gets to it first. When Slim turns around he sees Officer Reed LUNGING towar him. Slim FIRES the gun! BOOM. HE SHOOTS OFFICER REED IN THE NECK. Killing him instantly Slim drops the gun and stops breathing. Queen muffles her scream. Officer Reed's lifeless body lies on the pavement. A pool blood quickly forms around him. Queen applies pressure to her fresh wound and winces in p Slim gets up and runs to her side. He sees the blood runn down her leg.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh shit! He tries to help her up, but she doesn’t want his assista

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I got it. She slowly stands up. Gritting her teeth the entire time. Independence hurts.  16. Queen looks at the dead Police Officer.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Physically yes. Emotionally no.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Slim puts Queen’s arm around his neck. He knows she’s struggling to stand on one good leg. She kneels down and grabs the gun. Then she gently shoves in his pants. It’s their gun now. Queen turns to face Officer Reed’s squad car. The headlig are still on. Giving the small CAMERA on the DASHBOARD a perfect view of her face.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Let's go. Slim looks at her for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can’t just leave him here.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yes, we can. Now let’s go. Slim walks Queen back to the car. The engine is still purring. He helps her into the passenger seat. Slim walks around to the other side and gets in the drive seat. Still in shock. As they drive off into the darkness all we hear is the st filled radio coming from the squad car.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Officer Reed? Officer Reed, do you need back up? Officer Reed, do you copy? As we hear sirens far off in the distance, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim drives faster than his car is used to going. No musi playing. They’re no longer wrapping up a date. Now they’r fugitives, on the run. And one of them is wounded. Slim has no idea where they’re going. Neither does Queen. He’s just driving. Aimlessly. Slim grabs his phone.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I gotta call my dad. Queen snatches his phone and tosses it out the window. Sh chucks hers as well.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We can’t call anybody. It’1ll make them accomplices.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You could've just said that shit. Now we ain’t got no phones.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: A phone ain’t nothing but a tracking device anyway. Slim is shell shocked as Queen tries to take deep breaths

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You're bleeding a lot.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It's okay it only grazed me. The severity of what they did starts to sink in.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Fuck! Why didn’t you just stay in the car?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So this is my fault?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You should've just let me handle it.  18.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: If I didn’t get out the car you'd be dead right now. Slim looks at her wound. There’s a big gash.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We gotta get you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No! We can’t. Just keep driving.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Here -— Slim takes off his jacket while driving. She balls hell. She looks She grabs her teeth

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Use my jacket as a bandage. it up and presses it against her leg. It hurts like

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I have a small bottle of bourbon under the seat. at him with judgmental eyes.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I thought you didn’t drink.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t. My cousin stole that from a hotel and left it in my car. it and pours some on her open wound. Queen grits and presses against it to stop the bleeding. Slim’s mind starts to race. He can’t sit still.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if he was wearing a body cam? Or had a camera in his car. This shit bout to be all over the fucking news.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That's why we have to keep going.  19.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can’t run forever.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know that. But right now we have to run until we come up with a better plan.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Well, start throwing out some ideas.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Since when am I in charge of coming up with the ideas?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Since you made the decision to run.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We made that decision together.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t remember that.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We ain’t turning ourselves in, I know that much.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: If people watch the tape they’1l see what happened.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah - they’1l see you shooting a police officer, you idiot!

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Man, fuck this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim pulls the car over. He gets out and just starts walk

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Are you crazy? Queen limps out and hurries after him. Slim walks aimless up the road.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  20.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I‘mma find somebody with a phone so I can call my family.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: If you do that they’1l know where we are.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What if they kill us? That stops Slim in his tracks. He turns to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: There’s no guarantee they won’t. Then.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re a black man that killed a cop and then you took his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We took it for protection.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m not a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You are now. Slim stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I just want to go home. I wanna see my family. Slim's eyes start to water. Queen grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: If you turn yourself in - you’1l never see them again. And just like that. Something in Slim shifts. He feels powerless and small.  21.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All we can do is go forward. There’s nothing back there for us. Please. Let’s just keep going.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What about your family? You don’t care about leaving them behind?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No. I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can’t just keep driving. We need to figure out what the fuck we gon do.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Alright, let’s go to my uncle’s house. We can stay there for a few days. Then we can figure out our next move.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Where does your Uncle live?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That’s hours from here.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Then we should get going. They slowly walk back to the car. Hand in hand.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Al0 INT. SLIM'S CAR - MOMENTS LATER Al10 Slim blasts GOSPEL music. Queen stares out the window. Pissed.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Can you please turn that shit down?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s the only thing that calms me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Well I can’t hear myself think.  10 22.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t care. She turns it down.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t touch my shit.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So I can get out.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You ain’t going nowhere. We in this together now. All she can do is fold her arms and roll her eyes - becau she knows he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Queen’s hearts are still racing. Then the car st to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Why you slowing down?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m outta gas. Then the car comes to a complete stop. They can no longer ride on fumes.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you say something?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What you mean why ain’t I say something? I had other shit on my mind. They sit there quietly for a beat. Then they see a flash light. Headlights to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Okay, we gotta flag this car down.  11 23.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I hope they black.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (to herself) That’s not always a good thing. They both step out of the car. Nervous as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car gets closer and closer, Queen realizes -

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. The driver’s wearing a cowboy hat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Dammit. Slim crosses himself. Hoping for the best. The DRIVER is Mexican. His smile is friendly and his deme is warm.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Y'all having car trouble?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, we ran out of gas. The Driver sees Queen’s leg is covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Ma’‘am, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I accidentally cut myself. He looks at Slim and wonders if he’s stumbled upon a dome dispute.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Why don’t you guys hop in my truck? I’ve got a first aid kit in my backseat. And there’s a gas station up the road. I’1l give you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We don’t mind walking.  12 Al3 24.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Come on. I won’t bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in the truck. Slim immediately spots a SHERIFF'S BADGE sitting on the dash. While Queen climbs in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Uh no. I just didn’t know you were a sheriff. Queen looks up. Freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I’m off duty today. He pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHERIFF'S TRUCK - MOMENTS LATER Al3 Queen tries to take deep breaths while she bandages herse up. The bleeding has finally stopped. She uses a lot of g and tape because she doesn’t know when she’1ll be able to bandage it. It looks a mess - cause she obviously doesn’t know what she’s doing. Slim sits up front, sweating bullets.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You know what. We can walk the rest of the way.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Nah, I‘'1l let this be my good deed for the day.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Uh okay.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Y'all okay? You seem jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, we're fine. We just made a wrong turn somewhere and got lost.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: You're in Kentucky, my friend, but don’t worry - we’ll get you some gas and you'll be on your way. (then) How’s your leg?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Much better. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff looks at them for a beat. They stare back, confused.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Gas costs money.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I left all my stuff in the car.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I can pay you back when we get to the car. The Sheriff takes pity on them and walks into the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff grabs a red jug for the gas to go in and then walks up to THE CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I need to fill this up.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: That’1ll be ten bucks. The Sheriff hands him the money. Then he looks out the wi and sees Queen and Slim standing by his car. A VOICE from his walkie gives him an update.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: A Police Officer was shot and killed by two assailants in Ohio. A male and a female. Both African- American. One of the suspects was wounded by the officer. They’re said to be armed and dangerous. Let’s just keep our eyes open. He stares daggers at Queen and Slim. They can feel his ey on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen has her hand on the passenger door. Slim paces back forth.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Stop pacing.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I can’t help it.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You look guilty.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I am guilty.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Have you been charged with something?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Then you’re not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why is he staring at us like that?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cashier hands the Sheriff a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Do you need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. He grabs his walkie and talks into it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kind of car were they in?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: A white Honda.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Any other info?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: We're still waiting for the dash cam footage to come in.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Get in the driver’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Just do it. Quick. Slim hops into the driver’s seat. Queen gets in the passe side. Before Slim can turn the key - BAM!  18 28. The Sheriff holds the red jug up to the driver side windo Startling them.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Were y’all gon leave without me? And before he can blink - Queen holds the dead police officer’s gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Get in the car. The Sheriff does as he’s told. Without alarming anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff is driving while Queen holds a gun to the bac his head from the backseat. Slim is in the passenger seat wishing he could make himself disappear.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: My name is Edgar. I’ve lived in Kentucky all my life. My wife died three years ago and now I’m raising our son by myself. I’m all he has in the world. Watching him grow up has been the greatest blessing of my life.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I’m not gonna kill you. After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Did y’all kill that police officer?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It was self defense.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I’m sure it was. I have some colleagues that have gotten out of line more than once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back at Slim’s car. Queen keeps the gun to his he The Sheriff keeps his hands where she can see them. Queen looks a the Sheriff's truck and then she looks at Slim’s Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Pop the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Just do it. Slim does as he’s told. Then she looks at The Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get inside, please. The Sheriff struggles to get inside Slim’s trunk. There’s lot of shoeboxes in there. He finally gets inside. Once he’s in the trunk Queen leans over him.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened. But whatever it was, I’m sure you had good reason for doing what you did. Please. Let me help you. Queen just looks at him, with hurt and anger in her eyes SLAMS the trunk closed.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What’d you do that for? He wanted to help us.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: He ain’t gon help us. Slim takes a deep breath trying to calm himself down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s their job to make you feel like everything will be okay. But the second you confess you become property of the state. Is that what you want? You wanna be the state’s property?  20 30.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No. Queen gets in the driver's seat of the pick up truck and leans her head out the window.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You coming? Slim hops in the truck - and they’re off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is speeding down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I'm just tryna keep us from getting pulled over again. Queen wants to run away so bad. That’s her pattern. But s can’t this time. She’s trapped.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m hungry.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Me too. He sees a few fast food spots up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just stop at McDonalds or something.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Now ain’t the time to be choosy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen spots a few BROWN BOYS failing miserably at skatebo tricks in the parking lot. She sits up in her seat and lo eyes with one of them. He has a lot of meat on his bones and a face covered in freckles. We'll call him CHUBBY. She WAVES him over. Slim clocks this and freaks out.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What you doing? The BOYS don’t even try to stop Chubby from walking over. They just keep busting their asses on the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You wanna get some free food and make a little money?

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: What’s the catch?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ain't no catch, 1il man.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Aight. Queen hands him the last twenty dollar bill from her wall

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Let me get a double cheeseburger and the ten piece chicken nuggets with sweet and sour sauce.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I'll have a chicken sandwich with no condiments and a small fry. You can keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Ain’t gon be much left after all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sitting on the bed of the truck - under the stars  32. Slim eats fast and loud. Queen eats like a rabbit. She watches him devour his food with a disgusted look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You make a lot of noise when you eat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Woman, this could be my last meal - would you just let me be?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s hard for me to eat with you making so much noise. Slim tries to eat quieter. He fails, but Queen appreciate the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’ve never heard of someone not being able to eat because they’re disgusted by the sounds of other people eating.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know it’s weird, but I have a thing about it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How do you avoid the sounds of people eating?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I eat alone most of the time.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That’s not surprising. She cuts her eyes at him. Slim stops eating for a second.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You scared?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: How do you know?  A beat. 33.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You answered too fast.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I thought if a person answered too fast it meant they were telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: My dad always told me if a person answers too quick it means they had the lie ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Wow. Well that’s good to know.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How do you know if your clients are telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Then how can you defend them?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s my job.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: But why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I refuse to let certain states swap out a southern tree for an electric chair and call it justice.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Are you a good lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m an excellent lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why do black people always feel the need to be excellent? Why can’t we just be ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We should go.  34. She hops down and gets in the passenger side. Slim wonder why she was so abrupt just then. Maybe he struck a nerve. He shakes it off and hops in the drivers seat. But before they can pull off he hears --

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, is this y’all? Chubby plays them a video on his phone. It’s the DASH CAM FOOTAGE of Slim shooting Officer Reed in the neck. The video has already been viewed by over a hundred thous people.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, man. That ain’t us. Slim gets spooked and quickly starts the car. Chubby keep banging on the window.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Hold on, my dad wanna talk to y'all! As soon as he pulls forward he feels an IMPACT. He HIT something. Or someone.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy!!! Slim gets out of the car. Queen stays inside. Slim spots a LARGE BLACK MAN laying on the ground. Slim g to touch him, but he flinches.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I didn’t see you.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: You almost killed my daddy!

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I think you hit my bad knee.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Can you move it? He tries to and then he SCREAMS in pain. Chubby starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: You broke my daddy leg!  35.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Stop crying like a lil bitch. I’11 be alright.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Mommy told you to stop calling me a 1il bitch.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Nigga, I'll call you whatever the fuck I want. Queen hops out of the car to move this along.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We have to go now.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Y'all gotta take him to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We can’t go to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: So I can get y’all food, but you can’t take my daddy to the hospital? Large Black Man moans in pain every time he tries to move leg.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Where’s the nearest hospital?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We don’t have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Would you calm down!

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me like that.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’1l talk to you however I wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Ya’'ll sound like me and my bitch.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t call my mama a bitch!  23 36.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I ain’t talking bout yo mama. Slim tries to help the Large Black Man to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Come on, we’re gonna take you to a hospital. Slim, Queen, and Chubby all grab a limb and help him into back of the pick up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim drives carefully as to not irritate the Large Black Man's injury. Chubby holds his dad’s hand the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I support what y’all are doing.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Killing these crooked ass cops. We need to take all these muthafuckas out.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That’s not what we’re doing.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I saw the video, okay. If a cop shot at my bitch, I'd kill his ass too. Queen and Slim look at each other. Their hearts are racin

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cop killllaaaaassss!!!

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, man!

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Are y'all the new Black Panthers!? Is that what this is?

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: This is revenge.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: For that nigga he kilt two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Some dude was taking his daughter to school, minding his own business, and that cop killed him for no reason. Queen remembers the case. Slim cuts his eyes at her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Did you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Of course not. He doesn’t know what to believe. Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hospital’s on the left, pull over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim swerves into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Alright. We’re here.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY
dialogues.text: Y'all gon help me with him or nah?

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: They gotta lay low. It’s probably cameras all up and through this bitch. Chubby opens the car door and drapes his dad’s arm around neck. He stumbles a little bit, but eventually he makes i out and walks up to the sliding doors of URGENT CARE.  25 38. Before Slim can pull off, the Large Black Man turns aroun and says --

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Power to the people. He raises his right fist then he limps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Queen continue driving through Kentucky. They se rolling hills and tall phone lines that look like crosses

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How long before a helicopter starts flying over us?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Please tell me you didn’t fuck with that cop on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You seemed real calm when you saw his dead body.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: He shot at me.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You're crazy, man.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It should be a sin to call a black woman crazy.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You one of those people that thinks God is a black woman?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Lord help me.  26 39. Queen clocks the almost empty gas tank.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You're on E.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I really need you to start paying attention to that shit.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why don’t you pay attention?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You driving. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s smart for us to be walking into gas stations.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s not that scary. I told you what to do.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You only saying that cause you don’t have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You got this. I believe in you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Don’t patronize me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim stands in front of a TEENAGE WHITE BOY. This is his time job. And he hates it. Slim looks at the newspapers stacked in front of him. Him Queen’s faces are on the cover. The word “WANTED” rests above their heads in bold black letters.  40.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Let me get forty on pump nine. The Teenager waits for Slim to hand over the money. But instead - Slim lifts up his shirt and shows his gun. That’s his currency.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: Is that a .45?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: Can I hold it?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No, you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: I'll pay for your gas if you let me hold it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That’s not a fair trade.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: If you don’t let me hold it - you'll have to stick up another gas station.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I could kill you right now.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: You don’t look like a killer to me. Slim appreciates the fact this young man can see he’s not cold blooded killer. After a beat he takes the gun out of his pants and hands over. The kid goes from being an innocent Teenager to Joh Wayne in a matter of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why does holding a deadly weapon make me feel so alive? Then he aims the gun at Slim’s head. They stare at each o for a long beat. Slim starts to shake. The teenager holds gun steady. Barely shaking at all. While Slim fears for h life.  27 41.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What the fuck is you doing? The Teenager starts laughing and puts the gun down.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGE WHITE BOY
dialogues.text: I’m just messing with you. The Teenager puts forty bucks in the register and activat the gas pump. Then hands the gun back to Slim. And just like that he goes back to being a kid again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive in New Orleans. They pull up to a house far off the beaten path. It’s big but not well kept. This house used to be owned by people cared for it, but its new inhabitants could care less. Queen BANGS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Damn, why you knocking like you the police? No answer. She knocks again.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you didn’t throw our phones out the window we could’ve called.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: If I didn’t throw our phones out the window the police would've caught us by now.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Touché. This brings a small smile to Queen’s face. Then she keeps knocking. Until a TALL BLACK GIRL, with a in her belly and a glimmer in her eye, answers the door. looks like the romantic interest in every hip hop music v ever made.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: Can I help you?  28 29 42.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Is my uncle here?

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: Who’s your uncle?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Bitch, don’t play with me. The Tall Black Girl opens the door to let them in.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: He in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen walks through the house like she owns it. Slim trai behind her. She makes her way down a few hallways, and brushes by GODDESS - a half black, half Asian twenty- something girl. There’s no glimmer in her eye - just star Her eyes widen as Slim and Queen walk by.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Oh shit! It’s them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen opens the door to find her UNCLE EARL peeling shrim He’s rocking a red velour track suit and has a bald head. stands up and looks at Queen. From the look on his face they haven’t seen each other in while. Uncle Earl wipes his hands and walks over to give her a h The embrace is one-sided.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn’t the black Bonnie and Clyde. Earl reaches out to shake Slim’s hand. Earl’s hand is twi the size of his.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what the news is saying, but whatever it is - it’s not true.  30 43.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You know I don’t fuck with the news. I keep my ear to the streets.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: The streets lie too.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: They know better than to lie to me. Y’all hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Earl cooks up some CREAMY SHRIMP SCAMPI ALFREDO. It looks amazing. He makes plates for Slim, Queen, and the t beautiful girls we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I always hoped you’d escape this life without getting shot at. He leans back.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who patched you up?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: She did.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You ain’t do a good job. Earl stares at Queen for a long beat. A little too long. Causing her to look away.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your plan?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need to figure that out.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Well, y’all need to hurry up cause the cops are like slave catchers. They can smell a runaway from miles away.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m aware.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: How you gon outrun the police?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We don’t have to outrun them. We just have to make sure they don’t know where we are.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: That ain’t hard to do. Cops are dumb as shit.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: Not all of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: She only saying that cause she used to fuck one of them muthafuckas.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: Don’t be jealous.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I ain’t jealous of nobody. Niggas jealous of me. Before this turns into a bigger fight Queen interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We might need to stay here for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Hell nah. The SWAT team probably already on they way. And I can’t have them muscle neck muthafuckas sniffing around my shit. This puts the fear of God in Slim.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So what are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So you just gon let us get killed?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: That’s the risk you take.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Earl. She gets up to leave. Slim follows her. Goddess looks at with puppy dog eyes. Her charm is hard to resist.  Then -- 45.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: How long y’all need to stay?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: A night or two.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Well which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Two nights.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need some cash.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Enough to last us for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need one of your cars.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You can kiss my black ass.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLACK GIRL
dialogues.text: He love those cars more than he love us.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You want me to sign the house over to you or not?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You always tryna blackmail somebody.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I ain’t got no extra cars just laying around.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: What about the Cadillac?  46.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Goddess, if you don’t shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t know how inconspicuous we gon be riding around in a Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s the whole point. We’1ll be hiding in plain sight. Goddess sits on Earl’s lap.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you agree to my terms or not?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I’m not giving you no car. She gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You owe me. Those three words stab him in his stomach. Slim tries to the situation, but can’t make sense of it.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You sure this how you want me to pay you back? Queen nods.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Earl gets up and grabs the CAR KEYS from a drawer nearby. tosses them to Slim. Slim doesn’t catch them.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to figure out what the fuck you gon do when you leave here.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We will. Earl looks at Slim.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: She talk for both of y’all?  47.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Could’ve fooled me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I just wanna know what the nigga’s thinking. Cause he look kinda slow to me.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I think we should go to Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Now we talking! Ain’t that where Assata went after she killed that state trooper?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Allegedly killed.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We just gotta keep driving until we get to Miami and then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We'll be standing in front of a large body of water. How are we supposed to cross that?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t know yet.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Of course you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You got a better idea? For once she doesn’t. She gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where you think you going?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: To lay down. I’m exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Y'all ain’t going nowhere until we shave yo heads.  31

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We're not doing that.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You wanna keep walking around looking how you look in that video?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: No, you won’t.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You're not shaving my head.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Fine. I believe women have the right to choose - but you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Naomi, use the cheap razor on his ass. Tall Black Girl has a name. It’s Naomi. She goes looking the cheap razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 Slim sits on a stool while Naomi takes a razor to his hea He’s pissed.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Man, this is fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: This what happens when you on the run from the law. Earl motions for Naomi to keep shaving.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you guys have any wigs?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I live in a house full of strippers. Of course we got wigs.  32

INT. HOUSE - GODDESS’ BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS - DAY 2 32 There’s a row of about TWENTY WIGS. They all come in different colors, lengths, and types. It looks like a mus in there. Queen walks by them. Touching a few. Smelling others. She’s fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Take whatever you want. You can have some of my clothes too.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Then --

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Can I look at your leg?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: I took a year of nursing school. I know what I’m doing. Queen feels bad for judging her.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Alright. Goddess helps Queen take her pants off. Goddess slowly pu the bandage away. Queen winces.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I got you. They lock eyes. Goddess smiles at her. Queen smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t know Earl had a niece.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We’re not close.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Is he related to your mother or your father?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: My mother. She and I weren’t close either.  50.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Damn, who are you close to? She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Are you close to your family?

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. They don’t care how I make my money as long as I’m happy.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What makes you happy?

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: Robes at fancy hotels. A good lace front. And when your uncle kisses me on my forehead. Queen wasn’t expecting that answer.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. I’m just surprised by the amount of love he has in his life.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: He don’t always deserve it, but he needs us to worship him. Out there he ain’t shit. But in here - he a king. Queen let’s that sink in. She marvels at Goddess’ thin fr as she cleans her leg with precision. In another life Goddess could’ve been a nurse with an affordable mortgage, but in this one she occupies the fantasies of working class men who will never understand innocent she really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen walks into the kitchen wearing a Tina Turner wig. F her early Ike & Tina days. She looks more regal than befo She looks up and sees Slim leaning against the stove. Wit his newly shaved head. He looks like the second lead voca in an R&B group from the nineties.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know yet.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You like this shit.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. UNCLE EARL’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - LATER THAT NIGHT Uncle Earl is smoking a cigar while Naomi watches TV. She watching a cable news channel and the focus is on Queen & Slim. There’s talk of support for the two fugitives and t police being on their trail. She looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I know you stole my pinky ring.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Whatever nigga.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: It’s one of a kind. I designed it myself.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Don’t nobody care about yo fake ass ring.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: That’s your problem. You don’t care about shit.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: Oh that’s my problem?  35 52.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s your problem.

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: My problem is yo ass. Earl gets up and SLAPS her with the back of his hand. She falls out of the chair and hits the floor hard. Then she QUICKLY gets up and smacks his face. He flings her across the room. She then throws a lamp at head. He ducks just in time and it crashes into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: My mama gave me that lamp! As they continue to brawl, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Queen lie next to each other on a cozy bed.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, it sounds like somebody's fighting. Queen gets up and walks over to the door. She peeks out a sees Naomi and Earl yelling at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want me to talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Please don’t. Queen walks back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He didn’t used to be like this. Iraq fucked him up. She lays back down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna deal with this shit. Let’s leave first thing in the morning.  53. Slim and Queen lie next to each other in silence. Slim stares up at the ceiling. In a daze.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: How is that possible? You took somebody's life yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I guess, I’m just used to saying I’m okay even when I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What if God wanted me to die and I messed up His plan?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s what He wanted.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How you know?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I just think you were meant to be here. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m making an executive decision. We’re going to Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Executive decision? What do you think this is “Mad Men”?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can’t leave here tomorrow and not know where we’re going.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What about that large body of water?  54.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We'll figure it out. Queen has never been great at letting men lead. Right now she doesn’t have much of a choice.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That’s alright. I'll be brave enough for both of us. Queen lets out a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, why does your uncle owe you?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I got him out of prison once.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: He killed somebody.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Damn, who'd he kill?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: My mother. Slim is stunned by that answer. But he knows better than ask a follow up question. Slim turns off the light and turns over. Queen’s hand fin its way to his newly shaved head. She rubs it, gently.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m rubbing your head for good luck.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t believe in luck. I think everything is destined. Just as they start to relax - there’s a LOUD KNOCK on the door downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl opens the door to find a BLACK POLICE OFFICER standi there. He was picked on as a child so now he spends all h time in the gym.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Who the fuck called you?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I’m just here to make sure everybody’s okay. Earl turns to look at Naomi. Whose face is starting to bruise.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: You still fucking this nigga?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Then why the fuck is he here?

dialogues.speaker: NAOMI
dialogues.text: I ain’t call him. Earl turns to look at the Black Police Officer.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: A neighbor heard some commotion and got concerned.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I take good care of my property.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. She’s my biggest draw. The Officer looks at the side of the house and sees the Sheriff's truck.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You got a new truck? Earl is pissed Slim didn’t park that shit in the back.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I don’t know whose truck that is.  56.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You mind if I come in?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Not without a warrant, nigga. The Officer smiles.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you got the proper paperwork I‘ll give you a grand tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim peeks out the window and sees the police car.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Oh shit! The cops are here.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Officer takes a closer look at the license pla on the truck. The Kentucky license plate gives him pause.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I think I will come back with that warrant.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Make sure they use the big font. I can’t see shit.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Keep your hands to yourself, Earl. I don’t wanna have to come back here again.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: I ain’t want you here no way. The Officer looks at the license plate on the truck. Then takes a picture of it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 39 40 57. INT. UNCLE EARL’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER - N Slim and Queen run around the house frantically. They quickly change their clothes. Slim puts on one of Ea track suits. Queen squeezes into one of Goddess’ dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck that the black police officer just took a pictu of is currently ENGULFED IN FLAMES. Earl stands back and watches it burn with glee. He likes destroying things. Goddess hands Earl a small piece of paper. He looks at it for a beat. Then hands it off to Queen, al with an envelope full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Take this. The piece of paper has an address written on it.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That should cover your gas for most of the way. And the guy at that address will take care of you. His wife ain’t shit, but he’s cool. The address is in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Johnny Shepherd? Who’s he?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: We served together. I saved his life once. He’ll be expecting you. And he know a guy with a plane that can get you over that body of water. Queen hugs Earl as if she’1ll never hug him again. Then Earl hands Slim the keys to his BRIGHT RED CADILLAC. interior is ALL WHITE. It’s straight out of a blaxploitat film.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Thank you, Uncle Earl.  4l 42 58.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL
dialogues.text: Nigga, I ain’t yo uncle! And with that Slim gets in the car. Queen gives Goddess a hug goodbye. Goddess holds onto her dear life while Earl leans down and whispers into Slim’s

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take care of her. Then he taps the roof of the car.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Love you, baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Love you too. Slim backs out of the driveway carefully. INT. CADILLAC - MOMENTS LATER - NIGHT 2 Al Slim and Queen speed down a dirt road. Queen sees some CDs by her feet. Uncle Earl is old school he has albums by : FRANKIE BEVERLY & MAZE / THE OJAYS / GEORGE CLINTON. He also has albums by : TUPAC, TRU, and JOE. She picks one up and sticks it in the player. An old song starts to blast through the speakers. She tur it down - not wanting to draw too much attention, but Sli turns it back up. He looks at her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Queen drive through the bible belt. It’s a mix o beautiful landscapes and poverty.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful out here. Then they see a bunch of PRISONERS working the land. They in a long line. Moving in unison.  59. Queen’s heart aches for the men in blue jumpsuits who mea nothing more to this country than a pair of strong hands can do cheap manual labor.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I'm just tryna make conversation.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m just being honest.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Do you have to be honest all the time?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you want me to be silent?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that. There’s an awkward silence. Then Queen stares out the win for a bit. She takes in the fields, the colorful sky, and birds chirping. He’s right. It is beautiful. But there ar still some ugly parts she can’t ignore. Queen searches through the CDs and finds a pleasant surpr She shoves it in and hits play. Queen climbs into the backseat and lays on her back. Lett the wind blow through her long flowing wig.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What you doing?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m gon try to get some sleep. Slim has gotten more comfortable driving the Cadillac. He drives it like he bought it with his own money. Queen’s eyelids become heavy. Eventually she falls asleep Slim watches her in the rearview mirror. He’s never been more frustrated and enamored by anyone in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is awakened by loud music. But it’s not coming from car stereo - it’s coming from outside. There's a club a few feet away in the middle of the woods looks like the JOOK JOINT from THE COLOR PURPLE. Slim pulls over and slows down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I heard a band playing, I wanted to see where it was coming from.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need to keep going.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I know, but I’m exhausted. And you in the back knocked out while I’m tryna stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Fine, I’1l drive.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: When was the last time you heard some live music?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We're only a few hours from Florida. We got time. Queen listens to the music. Then --

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you have gone on a second date with me?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s not personal. I just like being alone.  61.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What was the second date gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m not telling you.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Come on. Don’t do me like that.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, you should've said yes.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. I’1l go.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s too late now.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I have the right to change my mind. Slim looks away.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay - I’m officially saying yes to the second date. Now, where we going?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m taking you dancing. Let’s go. Slim gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Can we dance once we get to where we're going? Just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m tired of playing it safe. Slim extends his hand to her.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You're willing to risk getting caught just so we can dance?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. Queen isn’t convinced.  44 62.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One dance and we can leave. I promise. She refuses to budge.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l buy you a drink. And with that, she grabs his hand and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is so crowded the walls are sweating. This sma establishment feels like it was built during a time when black folks still had to drink from the shitty water fountain. The lighting is pretty dim. And everyone is on the dance floor grinding slow and hard to a THREE MAN BAND playing King’s “How Blue Can You Get.” Slim takes Queen’s hand. Startling her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why you so jumpy?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m nervous.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ain’t nobody in here thinking ‘bout us. She rolls her eyes. Slim leads her to the middle of the d floor and pulls her in close. She shoves him away.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Watch your hands. Queen slowly puts her arms around Slim’s neck. He puts hi arms around her waist, careful not to touch her ass. The music gets louder and even more soulful as Queen and Slim start to find their groove. Slim looks around and realizes the prettiest girl in this place is in his arms. He can’t help but grin from ear to Then he looks down and sees Queen has rested her head on chest. She’s so close she can hear his heartbeat.  63. And right now it’s beating pretty fast. So is hers. Slim holds Queen a little tighter. She wipes the sweat from hi brow. As the song reaches a thunderous CRESCENDO Slim leans in a kiss - caught in the moment - Queen denies him.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you owe me a drink?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Bourbon. The expensive kind. Slim makes his way through the crowd. A few people look a him longer than they should. He makes it to the bar and finds a HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN slinging drinks. She recognizes Slim right away.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey handsome! Slim has never been referred to as handsome before.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Hi. He is out of his depth as he tries to pick the right alco

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Bourbon. She grabs a dusty bottle of bourbon from high on the shel and pours two shots.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t drink.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you should start. He looks at her perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are on the house. Slim grabs the drinks, but before he can leave she touche his hand.  64.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY SET BLACK WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. You’re safe here. They share a head nod. Then Slim quickly grabs the drinks and goes to find Queen

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: The bartender recognized me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh shit. We gotta go. Slim looks around and sees nothing but friendly and supportive faces. Queen drinks the shot. Slim drinks his too. It burns the out of his throat. Queen pats his chest and pulls him in close.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I think we good.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Trust me. She looks him deep in the eyes and allows herself to let The band plays a slower song. It’s romantic yet rough. Queen and Slim sway back and forth. Holding each other ti Burying their faces in each other’s shoulders. Some of the crowd backs away. Watching them. Admiring the Rooting for them. Praying for them. This looks like the first dance at a small wedding. Queen Slim look like a happy couple with their whole lives ahea them. As the song comes to a close the crowd applauds the band. Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen has her bare feet up on the dashboard. Slim gives h the side eye.
