dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You lucky you got cute feet.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Even if they weren’t they’d still be sitting right here.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, I would’ve stopped and got you some gym socks or something.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s messed up.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Honestly, I don’t think dudes even cared about women’s feet until Eddie Murphy made it a thing.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know. But the difference is he can be picky about a woman’s feet. The rest of y’all need to be happy somebody's even laying next to yo ass. She can see Slim is falling asleep at the wheel again.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Explain something to me. Why do dudes not like asking for help?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s a sign of weakness.  66.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s the dumbest shit I’ve ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You say that but then turn around and want a strong mandingo type muthafucka.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t want that.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That's a loaded question.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We ain’t got nothing but time. Queen leans back in her seat. She’s so far back she’s practically lying down. Like she were at a therapy sessio

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I want a guy to show me myself. Slim glances at her. Her legs are on full display.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want him to love me so deeply I’m not afraid to show him how ugly I can be. I want him to show me scars I never knew I had. But I don’t want him to make them go away - I want him to hold my hand while I nurse them myself - and then I want him to cherish the bruises they leave behind.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Damn, no wonder you still single. That’s a lot of shit. She can’t help but crack a smile.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Maybe it is.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: But you deserve that.  67.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t think we deserve anything in this life. We get what we work for. That’s it. She watches him drive. Drinking him in.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you want? He breathes deep.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I want somebody that’s ride or die.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh God. What does that even mean?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I just want somebody that’s always gon love me. No matter what. I want someone that’s gon hold my hand and never let it go. He looks over at Queen. They lock eyes. She wants to look away, but can’t. She's never heard someone describe love in such simple te

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She gotta be special though - cause she gon be my legacy.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Look, I ain’t gon bend the world. As long as my lady remembers me fondly. That’s all I need. As Queen lets that sink in, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim pulls into a gas station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen tries not to touch anything while washing up in a disgusting bathroom. She looks in the mirror for a long beat. Wondering how sh got here. Wondering what the future holds. Queen looks around the bathroom and realizes she’s all al in the world. Then - KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay in there? For the first time in her life a man’s voice reassures he that she’s not alone. The sound of Slim’s voice reminds her there’s a chance everything will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim leans against the wall outside the bathroom door. He watches people as they walk by. He wonders if they recognize him. He wonders if they’re going to turn him in Then he spots a LITTLE BLACK GIRL walking with her MOTHER The Little Girl locks eyes with Slim. She gives him the s eye for staring at her. Then she laughs at him. As if to taunt him for losing a staring competition he never knew he was a part of. The Little Girl’s sassy demeanor reminds him of Queen. This brings a smile to his face. As he stands there in a daze - Queen bursts out of the bathroom. Almost as if she’s reborn. They look at each other. Both smitten. Unsure of what the future holds. Then - Queen extends her hand to him.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Come on.  48 69.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You wash your hands? She grabs his hand with glee and they both rush to get ba in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is driving now. Slim rubs his bald head.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Skinny Luther or fat Luther?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Uh, skinny Luther.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ah fuck.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t trust people that like skinny Luther.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Skinny Luther was dope. He had a lot more energy. He sang better. And his clothes fit.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You crazy as hell. Fat Luther was the shit. Who else you know can pull off a jheri curl and a three piece suit at the same damn time? She's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right, nobody. As she continues to drive she sees a few HORSES grazing t land. She immediately pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What you doing? I thought you said no more stopping.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I changed my mind.  49 70.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You can’t change your mind. We gotta go. She puts her hand on his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Relax. He does. She slowly gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen walks up to the horses. Judging by her demeanor she more comfortable around animals than she is people. She goes up to one and takes the horse’s nose in her hand She becomes one with this beautiful living creature.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You crazy? What if it gets scared and kicks you in the face?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: They're not wild. Queen takes his hand and forces him to pet the horse. The horse is calm and so is Slim. It’s quiet all around them.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How you know so much about horses?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: My uncle used to take me horseback riding when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I told you he didn’t used to always be like that. Queen walks over to the other horse and looks in its eyes

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He told me nothing scares a white man more than seeing a black man on a horse.  71.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Because they have to look up at him.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’ve never been on a horse.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You should try it sometime. Queen starts walking back to the car. Slim doesn’t follow her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Maybe I should do it right now.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You can do it when we have more time. I’1l take you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What if we don’t make it? The weight of his question renders them both speechless.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You don’t know that. He’s right. She doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me get on the horse. Queen walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which one is the calmest? Queen chooses the one that’s still grazing. She holds Sli hand and helps HOIST him up onto the horse.  50 51 72. The horse BUCKS at first. Then Queen whispers to the hors and eventually the stallion calms down. Slim is nervous at first, but eventually he relaxes. Afte moment Slim’s posture shifts. He puffs out his chest and looks out into the world like the king he is. Queen looks up at him. They hold each other’s gaze for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: It’s nice isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Then -

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! The horse BUCKS again. But only this time Queen can’t cal him down. The horse knocks Slim off his back. Slim hits t ground HARD. Getting the wind knocked out of him. Queen helps him up and they run to the Cadillac. They hop in the car and speed off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun starts to set, the Cadillac starts to smoke. The smoke is coming from UNDERNEATH the car. Slim pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim is under the car. It’s smoking like crazy. Queen sta over him. Freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I think there’s a body shop up the road.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Really far up the road. Queen walks to the back of the car and assumes the positi  52 73.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Then we should start pushing. Slim gives in and they both start pushing the car up the road. They try to hurry while they still have light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim and Queen are spent. An OLDER BLACK MAN chews tobacc and blinks at them.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Your transmission’s fucked.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: That don’t sound good.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I can have it back to you tomorrow for about two grand.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Two grand?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need it back today.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Y'all in a rush? He looks at them suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re on our way to visit family.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Why y’all in a rush to do that? He lets out a hearty laugh and then spits tobacco juice i cup.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can try to get it back to you tonight but that'll cost you a little mo.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How much mo?  74.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Another five hundred. Slim pulls Queen to the side.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s all of our money.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Then fuck it - let’s just hop on a bus or something.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That's too risky.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You wanna give him all our money?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We need to get the car fixed. Then --

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, we doing this or not? Queen walks over and hands him the envelope full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Here. This is all we have.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We just need the car fixed as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I’ll move as fast as I can. Slim looks up and sees the mechanic’s office. He clocks a ROTARY PHONE sitting on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Can I use your bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s right through there. Queen sits on a bench. Arms folded. Looking at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 53 54 75. INT. OLDER BLACK MAN’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS - DAY 4 53 Slim sits in the bathroom holding the rotary phone on his lap. He takes a deep breath. Then he dials. Slowly. We hear the phone ring. MAN’S VOICE Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Dad? MAN’S VOICE Are you okay, boy?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine. MAN’S VOICE This ain’t like you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I know. Then --

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted you to know I’m okay. And that I love you. MAN’S VOICE I love you too, son.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We're tryna get to -- His father hangs up. Slim looks at the phone. Wondering w happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a POLICE OFFICER was listening to their conversati SLIM'S MOTHER, a dignified woman who never leaves the hou without makeup on, sits next to her husband - defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would you do that?! The Police Officer snatches the phone from Slim’s Father.  76.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Get outta my house.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You're under arrest for helping a fugitive.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Do what you gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: We're going to find them.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Not with my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Older Black Man fixes the transmission while Slim and Queen wait impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Y'all are making me nervous. Why don’t y’all go take a walk or something?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We're not leaving you alone with this car.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Ain’t nobody tryna steal your car.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Well I just wanna make sure.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: You got bigger problems than me.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: So you know who we are?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I’m old not blind.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Then why ain’t you give us a discount?  77.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Cause unlike the rest of these simple ass niggas I don’t approve of what y’all did.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We didn’t do it on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: It don’t matter if it was on purpose or not. You gave them a license to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That cop shot at me.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: You gave ‘em an excuse.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You weren’t there.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: No, I wasn’t. But if I was I would’ve taken the ticket and been on my way.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Can you work more and talk less?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I could work faster if y’all left me the fuck alone.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving this car.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: What if I gave you some insurance?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t want no house keys or no drivers license cause all that can be replaced. The Older mechanic walks to the garage door and knocks on After a beat a SKINNY BROWN KID no more than seventeen li it up. The young man looks like Barack Obama long before fell in love with Michelle. He wears a dirty T-shirt and skinny jeans.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?  56 78.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: You wanna take these nice folks on a walk? One look at Queen and Slim and he lights up like a Christ tree. He obviously doesn’t share his father’s views about them.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID
dialogues.text: Yeah! Then -

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I need some time to fix their car. Keep ‘em occupied until then.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Slim walks over and shakes the young man’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I'm -

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID
dialogues.text: I know who you are. It’s an honor to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY BROWN KID
dialogues.text: Everybody calls me Junior. His father beams with pride. Then Junior takes Queen’s hand and kisses it, sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim walk hand in hand. Junior leads the way.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to do around here. People just go to work and go home.  79.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I can’t believe y’all are here. I was just watching you on TV and now you're right here next to me. Shit is crazy. Slim remembers what it was like to be Junior's age. When weight of the world wasn’t on his shoulders and everythin was exciting.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope y’all make it. Without knowing it Junior reminds them their days could b numbered - and every breath should be cherished.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Even if y’all don’t it’1ll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Cause then you’1ll be immortal. Slim walks quietly - digesting the thought.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I like that. Queen takes a deep breath. Drinking in her simple surroundings. Appreciating the quiet. For once. Then --

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I'd rather live. They finally arrive at Junior's secret spot. It’s a small hill with a perfect view of the sunset. Queen, Slim, and Junior sit on the grass and marvel at th sun as it prepares to say goodnight. Queen looks at the purple and orange sky - then she looks Slim. He’s so serene. He’s made peace with whatever the outcome will be. Junior looks up to him. Literally and figuratively. And for the first time in her life - she sees God.  57 58 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim get back in their newly repaired Cadillac. turns on the car and it hums like it just came off the factory line.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yo, Junior. Can you take our picture?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Come on, I want proof we were here. This is proof Slim remembers everything. She likes that h using her own logic against her. She gives in. And they both look at Junior - ready to be captured. Queen has her hand on the wheel. Her toned arm on full display. Slim leans forward. He doesn’t look at the camer he looks at her as if she were his bride to be. Queen stares directly into the lens, the look in her eyes the perfect combination of fear and pride. We linger on them long enough to realize they’re no longe the people we met at the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is driving. Deep in thought. Slim is fast asleep. They drive by a sign that reads WELCOME TO GEORGIA. Queen stares at it for a long beat. It brings back an unwanted memory. She makes an impulsive turn. Jolting Slim awake.  59 81.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yo. She’s on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we make a detour?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I do actually. Queen doesn’t care and makes a hard left turn. She drives down a winding road. Tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Not really. He sits up and wipes the sleep out of his eyes. Slim can tell she needs to be held in this moment, but he doesn’t know if that’s permitted. He reaches out and touc the small of her back. She allows it. His hand is bigger than she realized. He rubs her back so at first - then he applies more pressure to help her rela and to make sure she feels his presence in a way she hasn before. Her heart is beating so fast he can feel her body pulse. heartbeat syncs up with hers. They are connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen stares at a tombstone. ETTA JOHNSON - BELOVED MOTHER AND DAUGHTER. Slim stands a few feet behind her. Far enough to give her space. But close enough to let her know she’s not alone.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We were close when I was younger, but when I got older I felt like I didn’t know her anymore. She didn’t know me either. We could go months without talking. And when we did - I hated it. I had nothing to say to her. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She wanted a connection so badly, but I just didn’t care. I didn’t need her anymore. She turns to look at Slim. Searching for judgement in his eyes. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I used to call her the great pretender.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: She was really good at acting like everything was okay. Queen extends her hand to Slim. He takes it and moves in closer. She kneels down and pulls up a few weeds crowding her mother’s resting place - all the while still holding onto Slim’s hand. Queen kisses her palm and touches the cold tombstone. This is what closure looks like. She lets go of Slim’s hand and makes her way back to the Slim hangs back. He stares at her mother’s grave a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim sit in a parked car. Slim is in the driver seat. Queen is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: My grandma left the house to both of them. My mom wanted to sell it. My uncle wanted to live in it. Typical family bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: One night they were at the house fighting, he was really fucked up, and he pushed her down a flight of stairs. She cracked her skull. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She bled out so quick that by the time the ambulance got there she was already dead. Slim hangs his head. Unsure of what to say.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had just passed the bar. I was excited to try my first case. I never thought that would be it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How could you defend the person that killed your own mother?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I knew it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Does it ever piss you off that he’s alive and she isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: All the time. Queen turns on the RADIO. We hear a journalist ON THE RAD reporting on a NATIONWIDE PEACEFUL RALLY in progress.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO PERSONALITY
dialogues.text: People are in support of the two fugitives accused of killing a police officer in cold blood. Slim and Queen aren’t really listening to the radio. It’s just background noise to them. Then Slim takes Queen’s face in his reliable hands and ki her. It’s so pure and innocent - it’s unclear if sex will follow. But then he pulls her in close and kisses her again. The second kiss is anything, but innocent. It’s the perfect combination of lust and melancholy. Slim pulls Queen on t of him. Rather than entering her right away - he lifts he to his face - her hands press up against the ceiling whil DEVOURS her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're following Junior walking down the street with purpo  62 63 64 84. We watch as he walks up on a protest. The same one the journalist spoke of on the radio. He joins - A SEA OF BLACK and BROWN BODIES are MARCHING i PROTEST. They are full of PRIDE and VENOM. They hold up signs in support of Queen and Slim. They cha and walk proudly. The PROTESTORS are surrounded by POLICE OFFICERS. The Officers are dressed in SWAT GEAR. Ready for war. The Officers form a line. The Protestors form a line oppo them. The Police stand completely still like statues of oppress in the South. The Protestors are vibrant not violent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim pulls Queen’s hair back and bites her neck. He follo each bite with a kiss. Queen reclines the drivers seat as far back as it will go kisses Slim deeply. As they continue to have sex, we --

dialogues.speaker: A POLICE OFFICER THROWS TEAR GAS INTO THE CROWD.
dialogues.text: Protesters cover their faces with t-shirts and hoodies. Some Protestors run for their lives while others run towa the Police. The Police Officers start BEATING protestors with BATONS chase after them while on HORSEBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is now gripping onto the steering wheel. Hands and sweating. Slim grips her waist and pulls her back and for  65 85. Windows fogged. Both gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior stands in front of the crowd. He looks like a youn Eldridge Cleaver. A BLACK POLICE OFFICER stops him from going any further. Officer is dressed in bullet proof gear from head to toe. Junior is only wearing a hoodie and sweatpants to protect him. It’s David and Goliath all over again.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: If you don’t vacate the premises I’m gonna have to arrest you, son.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I’m not your son.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: What’s your name, young man?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I don’t have to tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hurt you. Trust me. But it’s my job to clear the streets. Which means you can’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I have a right to protest.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I understand that, but you don’t have a permit. So that means you're breaking the law.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: What you gon do, kill me?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: No, but I will arrest you. The Police Officer LIFTS UP THE BULLETPROOF SHIELD ON HIS HELMET - so there’s one less barrier between them.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m begging you. Go home.  66 67 68 69 70 86. The Police Officer GRABS Junior by his arms -- in an atte to calm him down. But he wrestles free. Junior pulls out a SMALL HAND GUN. He aims it at the only part of the Officer’s body that’s not covered. He SHOOTS him in the face. Causing the Officer’s head to EXPLODE IN HIS HELMET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim thrusts his pelvis against Queen’s again and again u she finally throws her head back and SCREAMS with pleasur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior watches the Police Officer fall to the ground in f of him. He has succeeded in killing a giant that meant hi harm, but he feels justified just the same. A SEA of SWAT MEMBERS descend on Junior and tackle him to ground. His future is uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim lay intertwined in the backseat. Naked. Spent. Sweaty. Completely unaware the world is burning around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive along a winding road. They’re quiet and serene Slim reaches for Queen’s hand while she drives. She takes hand and doesn’t let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim rings the doorbell of a very middle class home. The grass is pristine. The windows are sparkling. An American flag blows in the wind.  87. It's safe to assume a soldier that came home with a purpl heart on his chest and a wounded heart behind it - lives here. The door opens. JOHNNY SHEPHERD is standing there. He is soldier. And he has the scars to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: We've been expecting you. Before they walk in Slim notices a NOSEY NEIGHBOR peeking the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SHEPHERDS sit on a couch across from Queen and Slim. MRS. SHEPHERD is a college educated with views more conservative than she’d like to admit. Mr. Shepherd has just given them a devastating update.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What do you mean they killed him?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: He shot a police officer in the face. Slim is shaken to his core.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We were just with him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: You knew the boy?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We spent some time with him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Did you order him to do it? Slim stands up. He wants to strangle her.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Queen grabs his arm and tries to calm him down.  88.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We would never do that.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: These kids think it’s okay to kill cops because of you.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Who made cops think it was okay to kill us?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We didn’t want this.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: (to her husband) There’s a war going on out there and you've welcomed it into our home.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: They didn’t start it. She cuts her eyes at his husband.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: I want them gone by morning.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can leave right now. Slim stands up.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go. This time Queen does as she’s told. The roles have revers As they start for the door.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Don’t let your pride get you killed.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I ain’t staying here.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: I got secret hiding spots all over this place. Even if the cops come here - they won't be able to find you. He thinks for a beat.  72 89.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Y’all hungry?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four sit at an old dining room table. This is the mos unusual double date we’ve ever seen. But the room is peaceful. The spread is something straigh out of the 1950s. A protein. A veggie. And mashed potatoe The only beverage available to drink is milk. Whole milk.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: There’s a bounty on your heads.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How much are we worth?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Two fifty.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Total?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Each.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That ain’t much.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: That could pay off our mortgage.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You gon turn us in?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: No. Queen cuts her eyes at Mrs. Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Earl told me you needed a plane.  90.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: I know a guy. I already gave hima call. Mr. Shepherd gets up from the table and grabs a notepad. WRITES DOWN AN ADDRESS and hands it to Queen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell him I sent you. Queen slips it in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: We should eat before it gets cold. Everyone grabs hands and bows their heads.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: I‘1l lead us in a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: May I do it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Of course. Queen takes a deep breath. She’s never done this before.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I'd like to start by thanking God for the breath in my lungs. And the breath in the lungs of everyone at this table. I’m grateful we have a place to sleep tonight and food to put in our bellies. Thank you for bringing us this far. Thank you for this journey. No matter how it ends.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD MRS. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Amen. Amen. Everyone starts to eat. Queen looks up at Slim and notice for the first time he’s not shoveling food into his mouth He’s not chewing like a cow. He’s taking his time and savoring every bite. This is a change he isn’t aware of, she is. Queen stares at him for a long beat and smiles.  73 91. Then AN AGGRESSIVE VOICE COMING FROM OUTSIDE interrupts t peaceful dinner.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The house is surrounded. Come out with your hands up. Mrs. Shepherd looks like she’s about to piss herself. Mr. Shepherd is no stranger to this type of situation. He is and collected.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Okay, I want you two to run upstairs and go into the yellow bedroom on the left. Hide under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: They'll find us there.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: There are loose panels under the bed. Hide under there and don’t make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Go. Now! Queen and Slim run upstairs in search of the yellow bedro While Mr. Shepherd quickly gets rid of Queen and Slim’s plates to make it look like there were only two people breaking bread instead of four.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have three seconds to come out or we're coming in! Mr. Shepherd grabs his wife’s trembling hand and walks he the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. & Mrs. Shepherd walk outside slowly with their hands raised. The SWAT LEADER immediately starts searching them both. M Shepherd dissolves into tears. Mr. Shepherd is stoic.  74 75 92.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Do you have a warrant?! He holds one up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to read that.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT LEADER
dialogues.text: Take all the time you need. Mr. Shepherd reads the warrant carefully. It’s legit. He nods at the police. Then with the flick of a finger th Swat Leader commands his team to enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They swarm the house like bees. Tearing it apart. They break antiques and damage the wood floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim make their way to the MASTER BEDROOM. They to lift up the panels under the bed. Some of them lift ea while others are stuck and won’t budge. Slim starts to sw bullets. Queen does her best to loosen them up as fast as can. They move quickly - but they aren’t fast enough. Determined FOOTSTEPS make their way into the bedroom. The bedroom door SWINGS OPEN. Silence. We follow the FEET looking in the closet and then out the window to see if they jumped. Then we PAN UP to reveal the feet belong to the Swat Lead that shoved a warrant in Mr. Shepherd's face. He stares at the bed and grins. Then he lifts it up with quick swoop, and -- Nothing. They aren’t there.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT LEADER
dialogues.text: Fuck! He lets go of the bed and it CRASHES against the floor.  76 77 78 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim lay close together. Shaking. Trying not to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police are loading the bright red Cadillac that Queen Slim have called home - for most of their journey - onto tow truck. It’s evidence now. The Shepherds are handcuffed and sitti in the back seat of a Swat Truck. The Swat Leader from be looks down at them.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT LEADER
dialogues.text: If you tell me where they’re going we can let you go and you can enjoy the rest of your evening. Mrs. Shepherd looks at her husband.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: We don’t know where they’re going. He kneels down and gets in Mrs. Shepherd’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT LEADER
dialogues.text: How bout you? You look a lot smarter than your husband. As we linger on her face, we --

dialogues.speaker: DAY 6
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim are half asleep. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We have to leave at some point.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m not tryna walk into an ambush.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I heard cars leave hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I’m sure they left some folks behind to keep an eye on the house.  79

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You can stay and die of starvation if you want to - but I’m getting the fuck outta here. Queen lifts the panels up one by one. They both take in t fresh air. They roll from up under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen walks over to the window that faces the back of the house. All that’s back there is a GARAGE and a small backyard. Queen lifts up the window and looks down. It’s low enough so they can’t kill themselves, but high enough that they could break a leg if they landed wrong.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: We gotta jump. Slim looks out.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: It’s too high.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: All you have to do is bend your knees as soon as you hit the ground. Bend and roll.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: This ain’t no damn fire drill. Queen climbs onto the window seal, takes a deep breath, a JUMPS out of the window. But she doesn’t take her own adv and forgets to bend her knees. She hits the ground HARD and lands flat on her back knock the wind out of her body and her LEFT SHOULDER OUT OF ITS SOCKET. Queen grabs her arm and rocks back and forth tryi not to scream. She’s in excruciating pain.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck! Seeing Queen in pain is the push he needed. He walks back few feet and runs toward the window LEAPING to the ground follows Queen’s instructions and lands perfectly. Rather than rejoicing he rushes over to Queen’s aid and p her into the garage.  80 81 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen is in so much pain she can’t speak.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Okay, I know how to do this. But you have to promise not to scream. Can you do that? She shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I believe in you. She continues to shake her head and backs away from him.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think there are cops out front and if they hear you - it’s over. We’re done. I know how strong you are. Those words give her the strength she needs.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Give me your shirt. He takes it off and balls it up. She stuffs it in her mou and gives him a nod to let him know she’s ready. Slim grabs her elbow with one hand and grasps her neck wi the other.
Then YANK! She SCREAMS but it’s muffled by his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE OFFICERS are standing guard out front. Police Officer 1, is out of shape and always in a good mood. Pol Officer 2, is too intense for his own good. Police Officer 1 hears Queen’s muffled groans.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Hear what?  82

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: It sounds like somebody’s crying.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: No, it’s just nature. You city boys ain’t used to that shit.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: Don’t refer to me as a boy.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: You know what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: Look, I know the difference between a person and an animal.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Then go walk around.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: Man, watch how you talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Touchy touchy. Police Officer 1 starts to walk around the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen rubs her shoulder - still in pain. While Slim searc for a key to the STATION WAGON parked in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Help me find a screwdriver. They both start searching.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You know how to jumpstart a car?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I used to. My older brother taught me one summer.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had a brother.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yup.  83 84 97. They lock eyes for a second - realizing there’s so much a each other they may never know. Then Queen finds an old toolbox. Slim digs through it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The only car we ever jump started was my dad’s. He used to take his keys with him everywhere he went. He knew better than to leave that Acura around us.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I see why. Slim finally finds what he’s looking for and hops in the driver's seat. Queen gets in the passenger. This is a far from Uncle Earl’s fly caddy. But they’1l take what they c get. Slim tries to convince the ignition the screwdriver is a but it doesn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Dammit. He takes it out and tries again. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police Officer 1 walks around, looking to see if anyone’s there. He sees the garage. But doesn’t hear anything. He cocks his gun, and walks over to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen digs through the toolbox again and finds a smaller screwdriver and gives him that. Slim puts that in the ignition and it works. The engine i louder than they thought it would be.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Now how we supposed to get outta here? Before she can answer.  85 86 98. POLICE OFFICER 1 LIFTS UP THE GARAGE DOOR. They turn to look at him. They’re caught. The Police Officer looks around and realizes his colleagu are out front - chatting with each other. He looks back a Queen and Slim and sees two faces that remind him of his He remembers why he became a cop. To help people. And at moment, no one needs his help more than the two people in front of him. They have a staring contest for about three seconds. Then he takes a few steps back and gives them room to bac up. Slim puts the car in reverse and moves the car back slowl Queen sinks low into her seat. Police Officer 1 nods his head as a way to say, “go head” They pull off and drive onto a SECLUDED side street. And just like that they’re on the road again. Police Officer 1 watches them go. Confident in his decisi He walks back around to the front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: A couple deer got caught in some branches. I set ‘em free.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Told you. As Police Officer 1 grins, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re almost in Miami.  99. Queen sticks her head out the window and lets the wind hi her face. For the first time in her life she feels comple free. No fear.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: What you doing? She doesn’t respond. Queen unbuckles her seatbelt and hoi herself up onto the window sill and leans on the roof of car.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! Get back in the car! She looks up at the sky. The stars seem bigger to her. Qu takes a deep breath - then gets back in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you tryna get caught?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, I just always wanted to do that.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Well, don’t do it while I’m driving.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: You should try it.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No. She grabs the steering wheel and YANKS it to the left. Th almost crash into another car.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I do it will you please let me drive the rest of the way in peace?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Swear on something you believe in.  87 88 100.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Okay fine, I’1l swear on you. And just like that a wave of freedom washes over Slim. She kisses him. As he pulls over, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen gripping the steering wheel while Slim tries to hoi himself up and out of the car window. He’s not as gracefu she is. He finally gets up there and tries to hold onto the roof the car, but his hands are sweaty so he loses his grip an FALLS BACK - with his arms flailing in the air.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Before he flies out of the car he grabs a hold of the rearview mirror and regains his balance.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Fuck this, I’m coming back in.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No, you got it. You’re good. I’1l drive slow. She slows down a bit and Slim finally gets a firm hold of roof. Queen picks up a little speed and Slim gets a whiff of th freedom she just got. Slim doesn’t know if he’1l ever fee this free again - so he cherishes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim are parked in an empty field - somewhere i Miami. It looks like an abandoned plantation.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is the address?  101. Slim gets out of the car and looks around. There’s no sig human life anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you please just get back in the car before you get shot.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Ain’t nobody out here. Slim gets back in the car. They’re both exhausted from driving all day.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was hoping we'd pull up toa house so we could get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Well, there isn’t one.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: They're gonna find us.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: No they’re not. Queen shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about you get in the back and get some sleep and I’1l sit up here and make sure nobody kills us. She gets out of the car and climbs in the back. The backseat is practically a bed anyway. Slim takes off jacket and places it behind her head from the front seat. Queen curls up in a ball and closes her eyes. Slim stares into the night. While he looks up at the stars, he hears

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I can’t sleep.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You want me to turn on the radio?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: No. I want you to tell me a story. He turns to look at her. Confused and annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of story?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Any story. I don’t care. He fidgets with his hands as he begins to speak.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: When I was little I asked my mom where babies come from. She said I was too young to know. So I went asked my dad. He said babies are the product of two people that needed something from each other. I didn’t know what that meant. So I said -- needed what? He said maybe they needed to feel seen. Maybe they needed to feel loved. Maybe they needed to feel human.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Then I asked my grandmother and she said -- babies come from God. They're His way of making sure no one ever really dies. I remember her saying “through our children we are reborn.” Queen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then I went to my older brother and asked him and he said, nobody knows. You're just born. That’s it. Now leave me alone. Slim chuckles at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t satisfied with that answer either, but I’d run out of family members to ask - so he got the last word.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So whose right? 102. Tears well up in Slim’s eyes. He wonders if he’ll ever se them again.  89 103.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: None of ‘em. Babies come from fucking. Plain and simple. They both chuckle. Then Queen’s eyelids become heavy. She eventually closes eyes and falls asleep. Slim stares at her. Grinning. Watching her sleep has quic become one of his favorite pastimes. After a moment he fi it hard to keep his eyes open as well. Soon - they’re both fast asleep. In a station wagon. In t middle of a field. Somewhere in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slim is in a deep sleep. Mouth open. Head tilted. Then we hear - CLICK CLACK. Slim JOLTS awake. There's a RIFLE aimed at Slim’s face. Once his brain comp what’s happening he scoots over into the drivers seat - t causes Queen to wake up too.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: What’s going on? She looks at the man holding the rifle. He’s a BLACK MAN a scruffy BEARD and inquisitive eyes. He’s wearing an oversized white t-shirt and his teeth are covered in 14 karat GOLD grillz. Queen and Slim aren’t sure if they should feel anxious or ease.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Why y’all acting all scared and shit?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Cause you pointing a gun at my face? He joyfully swings it over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Oh I’m just fucking wit you, playa.  104. He opens the door on the driver’s side. Slim gets out, cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You know the Shepherds?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: They were supposed to call you.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Y'all the ones that killed the cop, right? Slim doesn’t want to confess to this.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got you. Follow me. He walks pretty fast. Queen and Slim trail behind him. Th

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How do you know the Shepherds?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: From way back.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Man, I don’t know - why you giving me the third degree. I’m just tryna help you. Queen and Slim try to keep up with him.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: They said you had a plane.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: They lied about that. Slim stops his tracks. Queen and the Thin Black Guy stop

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: If you don’t have a plane we not going with you.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Look man, I ain’t got that kind of money. But I got a friend that do. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He a baller. He can get whatever you want. When we get to my trailer Imma call him.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Why can’t you call him right now?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Cause I ain’t got my phone on me. Queen looks skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, y’all can either roll with me or stand here like some dummies and wait for the police to come get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim sit in the Black Man’s tiny trailer. He’s smoking a blunt while he wraps up his call.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Aight - he gon have the plane ready to go first thing tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: We can’t wait until tomorrow. We gotta go now.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Damn, y’all some bossy muthafuckas.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Call him back. Slim grabs the cordless phone and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Sorry bro, they trippin. They said they gotta go today, nigga. That’s what I told ‘em. Aight. Bet. He looks at Queen and Slim and shrugs his shoulders. Then hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He said meet him in a hour.  106.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Okay cool. Slim and Queen settle in.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is y’all doing? It’s a hour away - we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queen and Slim sit in the backseat holding hands while th bearded Black Man drives. He rolls another blunt while he drives. He’s great at multitasking.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Y'all wanna hit this shit?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: I don’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Word?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about you, sis?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Shit, if I was y’all I'd be smoking like a muthafucka. He lights the blunt and brings it to his lips and blows o large cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s why I smoke all the time. Shit, I’m paranoid as fuck. I always think somebody tryna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Police. Niggas. Everybody.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: That’s no way to live.  107.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: What you gon do? That sticks to Slim’s ribs.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: I’m glad I met y’all, though. He reaches out his hand for Slim to grab. They quickly da each other up.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: So are we, man.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Y'all really gave niggas something to believe in. This brings a proud grin to Slim’s face.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We needed that. For real. Queen reaches forward and grabs the blunt out of the Bear Black Man's hand. She takes a huge hit. As she blows it o

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew you wanted to hit that shit. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Live yo life, sis! Then she passes it to Slim. Nudging him to do it. He wave her away at first.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Come on. For me. That does it. Slim takes the blunt and hits it a little t hard. They both laugh at him. Then the Bearded Black Man looks out the window and sees small PLANE up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: There that nigga go.  92 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s the kind of plane famous people get on to die. He pu up along side it. Queen and Slim hop out. They both shake his hand with gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Power to the muthafucking people. Queen grabs Slim’s hand and they both start walking towar the plane. It’s been a long road to this point. They’re ready to lea it all behind. Then -- They can hear HELICOPTERS floating above them. They both up. Fuck! They turn around to find FIVE SQUAD CARS lined up. TWO COPS step out of each vehicle. GUNS DRAWN. The Bearded Black Man with the kind eyes was a Judas afte all. One of the Police Officers gets on the bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Get on the ground now! Put your hands behind your head. Queen and Slim look at each other. Never letting go of ea other’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on the ground now!

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: There’s no getting out of this, is there? Slim says “no” with his eyes. Queen looks up at the sky - and somehow manages to muster smile.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well. I’m not letting go of your hand.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: If I had the chance I would've kissed all your scars.  109.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I know you would have. Queen looks at him with tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I be your legacy?

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You already --

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: A BULLET - traveling faster than the speed of light - pie through Queen’s chest. Causing her body to DROP. And just like that... a complex beauty with beautiful bro skin and a tortured past is gone. Slim kneels down and takes her in his arms. He stands up holding her lifeless body. With tears streaming down his face he walks toward the po slowly and deliberately. The police are stunned and confu What the fuck is he doing? It doesn’t matter. All we know, is his death is imminent.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Stop walking! He doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your hands up, now! He doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop or we’ll shoot! He keeps walking. Defiantly. Then -- BOOM! BOOM! Two bullets BLOW through his chest. He plummets to the ground. Never letting go of her. He died just as he had lived - with pride and a quiet dignity. They both lay there on the pavement. In a pool of their o blood. Their bodies making an unintentional cross.  93 94 110. The COPS put their guns down. Feeling powerful and guilty the same time. It’s an adrenaline rush they can’t describ The Police Officers look at Queen and Slim’s dead bodies. Observing them. Not unlike a hunter observes his prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see thousands of people glued to their TV and iPhone screens as they watch what just took place. This is publi theater. It’s like the OJ Simpson verdict all over again. Only thi time black people are on the losing end.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Angela Johnson and Ernest Hinds were shot and killed today by Miami Police. The two suspects have become quite infamous for their ability to escape authorities after killing a police officer four days ago in Columbus, Ohio. Miami Police Department released a statement saying they hoped to arrest the suspects so the they could have their day in court, but they had no choice but to open fire. We'll see THE SHEPHERDS watching from home. Mrs. Shepherd watches with conflicted eyes. Mr. Shepherd has to look aw We'll see GODDESS and NAOMI watching on their phones in Earl's overcrowded house. Earl smokes a cigarette and pretends to be unfazed. But he is. He’s never felt more a in the world than he does right now. We'll see Junior’s father watching from his shop. He does have much space to mourn other people’s children when he’ still mourning his own. Finally - we’ll see the Bearded Black Man watching. He si in his trailer with a blunt dangling from his lips while counting his reward money. We'll search for remorse behin his eyes, but we won’t find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is covered in blood and water.  95 96 97 111. The CORONER is a dignified black man with salt and pepper hair. He washes Queen and Slim’s bodies as if they were his favorite cousins. He prays over them. He does it in a voice low enough so he won’t get in troub but loud enough so God will hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNDREDS OF PEOPLE, mostly Black and Latino, stand in the streets holding flowers with sad eyes. They pour into the streets to pay their respects to two ordinary people that became sacrificial lambs. It’s reminiscent of BIGGIE’S funeral. Only this time ther no music being played from boom boxes. There’s no animati or joy to be found. We see Slim’s beloved father in the crowd. He bows his he and takes off his hat as his son’s casket rolls by. Slim's family consists of his OLDER BROTHER, his ELEGANT MOTHER and HIS BROTHER'S CHILDREN - two nephews and one niece. The only person there to grieve QUEEN is Earl. He cries uncontrollably as he reaches out to touch her casket. It’ covered in white hydrangeas. Her favorite. YOUNG KIDS hold up the PHOTO Junior took of Queen & Slim the car. As we linger on the photo and their innocent faces, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE LITTLE BLACK BOYS, run through an apartment complex. They're making their way to a basketball court. As they play - we notice one of the boys is wearing a t-s with Queen and Slim’s faces on it. And just like that they’ve gone from skin and bones to mythical beings that everyone wishes they knew.  112. Heroes that everyone admires and young people will emulat for generations to come. Whether you call them sacrificial lambs, revolutionaries just two innocent people that defended themselves -- thei names will live on forever. But for the purposes of this story -- they will always be known as Queen and Slim. FADE TO BLACK.
